instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  ISL95530HIZ-TR headache
threads.message: Does anyone know if there are compatibility differences between ISL95530HIZ-TR5664 and ISL95530HIZ-TR5655?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  ISL95530HIZ-TR headache
threads.message: You are screwed, they have firmware and you need to pull from donor board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  ISL95530HIZ-TR headache
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 35374"]You are screwed, they have firmware and you need to pull from donor board.[/QUOTE]

and re ball them? That makes me pretty sad!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  ISL95530HIZ-TR headache
threads.message: I have found no other solution. I have never gotten PPBUS after replacing it with a new one.
